title: Clark County Court Administrator of the District Court Jury List Request

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Clark County Court Administrator of the District Court Jury List Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to NV Rev Stat § 6.045(5)(c)(1)

The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

title: Changes to usaid.gov (United States Agency for International Development)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Changes to usaid.gov (United States Agency for International Development)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records beginning on noon, January 20, 2025, Eastern Time through midnight, February 2, 2025, Eastern Time regarding modifications to the usaid.gov website . Please include the records of source code modifications, infrastructure or software configuration, directions to staff or contractors on what modifications to make, content management system logs (or similar logs should a content management system be used) and documentation of changes to the DNS and other similar records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

realmaga

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by USAID
communications.communication: Dear realmaga realmaga, This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the United States Agency for International Development. The tracking number for your request is F-00527-25. Please use this number when corresponding with this office. At this time, we are in the process of perfecting your request. A perfected request for records reasonably describes such records and is made in accordance with the published rules stating the time, place, fees (if any) and procedures to be followed. This process includes reviewing the request for clarity and fee category determination and related commitment to pay, if applicable. Once your request is perfected, you will be notified of the Government Information Specialist assigned to process your case. If you have questions, please contact us on or by e-mail at (tel:(202) 712-0960) (202) 712-0960 . Please cite the above-referenced number when corresponding with our office. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) foia@usaid.gov Sincerely, The FOIA Team USAID - Washington DC

title: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any talking points, notes, or scripts prepared for the press conference mentioned here 

https://twitter.com/VibrantRRHA/status/1780986538077098003

created between April 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference
communications.communication:
Dear Tom Nash,

Richmond Redevelopment and Housing Authority (RRHA) acknowledges receipt of your FOIA request, dated January 23, 2026, January 8, 2026, and April 18, 2024 as you stated in your email, received in the FOIA department on January 23, 2026. I am not sure why your previous requests were not seen until today and apologize for the inconvenience that may have been caused. Your request is for talking points, scripts, and notes used to prepare for the press conference held on April 19, 2024.

The link provided did not work for me, however I located the press release and believe you are referring to the "RRHA Addresses Lease Enforcement Cases Due to Non-Payment of Rent" Press Conference held on April 19, 2024 at 10 a.m. Please let me know if I am incorrect.

Upon further review, a response will be provided to you within 5 business days of your initial request date. Day 1 is considered the day after your request is received. The five-day period does not include weekends or holidays.  If it is not practically possible to identify, locate, or provide the records you requested within 5 business days, RRHA may require an additional 7 business days to respond to your request pursuant to Va. Code § 2.2-3704(B)(4).

RRHA reserves the right to charge a reasonable fee for searching, duplicating, and supplying the requested records, but the fee shall not exceed the actual costs incurred. You may request an estimate of the cost in advance of receiving the requested records.  All requests received by RRHA are handled pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, Va. Code § 2.2-3700.

Please let me know if you want to modify your request or if you have any questions. Again, I apologize for this delay and any inconvenience this may have caused.

Sincerely,

title: Report and BWC from Firearm Discharge in Hotel

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Report and BWC from Firearm Discharge in Hotel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

On January 20, 2026 the Minnesota Star Tribune published an article titled "ICE agent accidentally fires gun into Eagan hotel room." To assist with your search, the article included: "The gunshot occurred Dec. 18, at the Hampton Inn Minneapolis-Eagan, located at 3000 Eagandale Place."

We are seeking additional information on this accidental discharge. Please provide the following records:
1) Police report and related supplements and media (photos/videos)
2) 911 Call Audio related to the incident 
3) BWC for responding officer(s)
4) Any interview transcripts or recordings (if separate from #1. If they are included in #1 then please ignore this line)

Thank you for taking the time to fulfill this request. Please feel free to send any of the above items as they become available, they do not all need to be sent at once.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000275-121625
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Records Request of December 16, 2025, Reference # R000275-121625 Dear Kung Joe, The Bellevue School District Public Records Office received the following public records request from you on December 16, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All email exchanged between Bellevue School District and the Washington State School Directors' association (*@wssda.org) for all time. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Kung Fu Joe 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2156999/ In accordance with , we are acknowledging receipt of your request and providing notice that the District will require additional time to respond. This time is needed to seek any clarifications to the request and to locate, assemble, and review the requested records.  RCW 42.56.520 Please note that this request may be subject to applicable fees as permitted by the PRA. RCW 42.56.120. The District charges 5 cents for 4 electronic files/or attachments. RCW 42.56.120(2)(b)(iii). We will let you know in advance if there will be a fee and whether, in keeping with RCW 42.56.120(4), a 10% fee deposit will be required before we proceed with your request. Please be aware that, in keeping with our obligations under the Washington Public Records Act (PRA), any information that personally identifies a student (unless the requestor is that student’s parent or guardian) must be redacted from all materials provided in response to a public records request. RCW 42.56.230(1). We ran some preliminary searches to get a sense for the number of potentially responsive emails. A search for emails from/to/cc @wssda.org returned only 8 emails, which have been uploaded here: Public Records Request - R000275-121625  A search for messages from/to/cc “wssda” returned 111,302 messages, many of which were mass mailings relating to news updates. When we ran a search omitting the most common of those bulk messages (using the search terms below), we had 29,840 messages. The applicable fee for that number of messages would be over $350 – and it seems possible that a large number of those emails might not be of interest to you. We ran that same search just for the period from 12/1/25 to 12/16/25 and had 31 results. We have attached those messages so you can take a look at the types of records the search is pulling up. If you have additional search terms you would like us to use or a specific date range that you would like us to pull first, please let us know. We want to make sure you get what you are interested in without unnecessary expense and without having to slog through records that are of no interest to you. Once we have your direction for a revised search, or your go-ahead to continue with the 29,840-result search, we will provide you with an anticipated fulfillment date and a fee estimate. Please let us know if you have any questions. Sincerely, Sarah Kolpacoff 
Public Records Officer

Please log in to the Public Records Portal at the following link to retrieve all responsive records. Pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download. Public Records Request - R000275-121625  There are 150 emails responsive to your revised request. Because the fee for that number of records is less than $2 ($1.87), we are waiving the fee and providing you with the records. This completes our response to your request. We will be closing our file and will take no further action. Please let us know if you have any questions. Please note that, if you wish to seek judicial review of our handling of your request, you have one year from the date of this communication to file an action in King County Superior Court. See RCW 42.56.550(6). Sincerely, BSD Public Records Team

title: Military equipment (Brownsville Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Military equipment (Brownsville Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An inventory of all military equipment held by the department as of the date of fulfillment of this request. The request includes but is not limited to: 

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.
(15) Any other military equipment purchased by/for or transferred to the department. 

Requested components of the inventory:
The inventory should include the manufacturer, model number, quantity, initial costs of obtaining the equipment, and estimated annual costs of maintaining the equipment of each type of equipment, where "type" means each item shares the same manufacturer model number. 

The inventory should also specify under which program the equipment was obtained if applicable, including but not limited to the 1033 Program, the 1122 Program, the US Department of Homeland Security Grant Program, US Department of Justice’s Justice Assistant Grant Program, DOJ Equitable Sharing Program, US Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund’s Equitable Sharing Program, and The General Services Administration Federal Surplus Personal Property Donation program.  

I am also requesting a list of all military inventory that has gone missing in 2024 and 2025. 

I am a journalist employed by the news outlet The American Prospect and I am requesting a waiver of all fees. The disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the tools available to the department to maintain safety and order, and protect against attacks from both domestic and outside sources.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitney Wimbish

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Seminole County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Seminole County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Rose Terse

SKAMANIA COUNTY PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of February 03, 2026, Reference #C003886-020326 Dear Ms. Terse: Greetings. My name is Joseph Anderson and I am a Deputy Public Records Officer for Skamania County. I assist inreviewing and responding to public records requests (PRRs) for alldepartments. 

On February 03, 2026, I received your public records request as follows: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2208085/." 
Please note that Skamania County does not have a ' Brady List' per se.  There is one (1) deputy that worksfor the Skamania County Sheriff’s Office for whom we have potentialimpeachment information and for whom we provide a memo disclosing and summarizing thecircumstances. We provide this memo when required to defense counsel oncases involving this deputy. Because there is only one (1) local deputy forwhom we maintain potential impeachment disclosure information, there is no list. Just the singlememo, which we are happy to provide [ please see attached]. 

TheWashington State Patrol sometimes sends us information from state-widepotential impeachment issues with WSP employees. We do not maintain thisinformation in any organized way because it does not apply to anyofficers that regularly appear in our courts/cases. I just want toconfirm that these records are not made into any list, and to the extentthat these records are related to WSP employees, are likely bettersought from the WSP directly, if you’re interested in the raw data (inaddition to any lists). After reviewing our files, we have located records that are responsive to your request. Please log in to the Skamania County Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the records responsive to your request: County Public Records Request - C003886-020326
SkamaniaCounty has searched for, attempted to identify, locate, and provide anynon-exempt public records that may be responsive to this request. Since this completely fulfills your request, we are now closing this public records request. The one (1) yearstatute of limitations to seek judicial review under the Public RecordsAct (Chapter 42.56 RCW) begins now because Skamania County does notintend to further address this request. Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns by replying to this email or at my phone number below. 

Sincerely, 

Joseph Anderson 
Deputy Public Records Officer 
Office of the Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney 
240 NW Vancouver Avenue | PO Box 790 
Stevenson, WA 98648 
509-427-3791

title: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. § 1-200 et seq.), I respectfully request access to the following public records:

PRIMARY RECORDS REQUESTED:
- All communications between YMCA staff and Wallingford Public Schools personnel from January 1, 2024 to present
- Documentation of any complaints, incidents, or issues involving YMCA members or programs from January 1, 2024 to present
- Records of staff training regarding confidentiality, member privacy, and professional boundaries
- Any communications with legal counsel regarding member disputes or staff conduct issues from January 1, 2024 to present

COMPREHENSIVE DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS:
This request includes, but is not limited to:
- All responsive records regardless of format (paper, electronic, audio, video, social media, messaging apps)
- Records stored on personal devices if used for official business
- Records in possession of contractors, consultants, or third parties acting on behalf of the agency
- Draft documents, notes, calendars, and informal communications
- Records that have been deleted but remain recoverable
- Metadata and audit logs associated with electronic records

SEARCH REQUIREMENTS:
- Search all relevant custodians, not just those specifically named
- Search all email accounts, shared drives, and backup systems
- Include records of employees no longer with the agency
- Search alternative spellings, nicknames, and partial names

PRODUCTION STANDARDS:
- Provide records in native electronic format when possible
- Do not convert searchable documents to non-searchable formats
- Preserve all metadata including timestamps and sender/recipient information
- Provide a privilege log for any claimed exemptions

If any responsive records have been destroyed, please provide:
- Documentation of the destruction
- Reason for destruction
- Date of destruction
- Authority for destruction

If you claim any exemption under the Freedom of Information Act, please:
- Identify the specific statutory exemption
- Explain how the exemption applies to each document
- Provide redacted copies where partial disclosure is possible
- Consider whether public interest outweighs any claimed exemption

This request seeks records that serve the public interest in government transparency and accountability. Please construe all exemptions narrowly and err on the side of disclosure.

Please preserve all potentially responsive records immediately upon receipt of this request to prevent spoliation.

As these records serve significant public interest, please waive all fees. If fees cannot be waived, please provide detailed cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your assistance.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

john Conrad

- Search alternative spellings, nicknames, and partial names

PRODUCTION STANDARDS:
- Provide records in native electronic format when possible
- Do not convert searchable documents to non-searchable formats
- Preserve all metadata including timestamps and sender/recipient information
- Provide a privilege log for any claimed exemptions

If any responsive records have been destroyed, please provide:
- Documentation of the destruction
- Reason for destruction
- Date of destruction
- Authority for destruction

If you claim any exemption under the Freedom of Information Act, please:
- Identify the specific statutory exemption
- Explain how the exemption applies to each document
- Provide redacted copies where partial disclosure is possible
- Consider whether public interest outweighs any claimed exemption

This request seeks records that serve the public interest in government transparency and accountability. Please construe all exemptions narrowly and err on the side of disclosure.

Please preserve all potentially responsive records immediately upon receipt of this request to prevent spoliation.

As these records serve significant public interest, please waive all fees. If fees cannot be waived, please provide detailed cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your assistance.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

john Conrad

title: blended

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: blended
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges: 

https://www.whqr.org/local/2025-05-09/wrightsboro-parent-pushing-for-book-ban-appeals-after-school-committee-rejects-their-challenge

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “blended”, “dei”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, or “leak”. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discuss book bans B) any other document that has been used to help explain book bans, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning  “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, “leak”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

Please perform this search for records between April 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

title: Boulder County Flock ALPR

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request #R000116-011526
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by Boulder County Sheriff's Office.
2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present.
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically:
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.)
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities.
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to:
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Spratlin

communications.subject: Records Request :: R000116-011526
communications.communication:
Dear MATTHEW SPRATLIN: 
We appreciate your interest in criminal justice records of the Boulder County Sheriff’s Office. Your request was received on  1/15/2026 and will be processed according to the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (CCJRA), C.R.S. 24-72-301 et seq., and other applicable laws. Disclosure of records involving children may be restricted by the Children’s Code Records and Information Act, C.R.S. 19-1-301 et seq. 
The Sheriff’s Office Records Section does not process requests for public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Requests for public records under CORA should be submitted to the Boulder County’s Open Records Center available at https://bouldercounty.gov/records/colorado-open-records-act/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBToUhCNwPrijCljaecY3mINRUTFikS2djaQyg-2FJ7hIZ8luPa63HTgmuk3H1tWjGbKI-3DQW5S_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFlM-2FT-2FZ7glL-2BBqYg9N4wYHZ8lWuxVeAa-2B7P3ulgRA8fuExOEDO32UGNLt8gJiNNi-2FTmlOXJMMM5C6bP7PaJw-2F7l8wABoXl3wkVYCMFqPMD8UbKoFrnP9oUF-2FgVIN352e055NnrnUqbc7SpPbnSvla8Q-3D) 
You will receive an email when the response to your request is ready. While the Records Section is working diligently to respond, please note that the 3-day timeframe for inspection under CORA does not apply to requests for criminal justice records under the CCJRA. This request can be tracked at the link below using assigned reference number R000116-011526. 
The Sheriff’s Office also publishes certain criminal justice information online, including daily booking and listing reports for the Boulder County Jail, available at: https://bouldercounty.gov/safety/jail/listing-and-booking-reports/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBT2MJBJQmvdwUDiv0zYVq10kivwqXhRz5ZRo0NzoQrJNkh6yFBa-2FP7KQLm7eFSs948-3DpP8T_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFmKLNulZn-2FRuB2-2FuXNkTTOzLJFJlIucpmrnUfewSM76Sk5iGKQX7kfEvKZzeodUz-2B28lQGCUaemLEQi91br7cP1GeS8gScJHiYoQgC9C-2FbVNq9vqZJ2XXtctyOajwSoXHsSeZs8Sfzf9ox88G5zqe3A-3D) 
Thank you for using the records request center. 
Boulder County Sheriff’s Office 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Records Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXZ1-2FPdBW8Q1BjPLvu8R38Ih5Vs8D-2FKYdTSTFPiP9LlOewvdyD75zx-2BhdIuphLSZ6TqXMxuN-2FiP-2Bw91l3ufz2YtM-3D8nnO_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFoeMMA8pEbbxYJpyqpbcTWolVjBDs0ycj2j-2F10UphRtdLkdDM-2FW2aUdGFB2oHiQfAnAPIE3o8NS7AWxWa-2FfBQxqJhSe80nM4OYefGSR5IqlIMzEfr9Rb7zIH8k73RYo-2B6-2FhWSFAd0HmJm3Ij7AZq32M-3D)

2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present. 
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically: 
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.) 
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable 
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities. 
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to: 
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases 
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access 
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action 
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Matthew Spratlin 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2179756/ 
You will be contacted about the availability of records and/or provided with copies of the records. Depending on the scope of your request, a deposit and/or extension may be requested. If a deposit and/or extension is needed, Boulder County will contact you with an estimate before proceeding. All communications will be through the Boulder County Records Center. PLEASE NOTE: The Colorado Open Records Act (CORA) does not require Boulder County to create new records, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request under " My Requests" in the Boulder County Open Records Center.

title: Watsonville - Airport Blvd

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Watsonville - Airport Blvd
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am stating the purpose of this request so that you may assist me as required by California Government Code (“Gov”) § 7922.600(a)(1). The purpose of this California Public Records Act request is to determine the existence or non-existence of a specific record. 

Please note that I am not requesting the record itself, only confirmation of its existence or non-existence. Thus, Civil Code § 1798.90.55, law enforcement exemptions, the public interest exemption or any other laws or exemptions do not apply to, and are not relevant to, this request. 

Please confirm the existence or non-existence of the following Flock Safety ALPR footage record:

License Plate: 9SYY133
Date: January 20, 2026
Time Frame: 12:05 PM - 12:15 PM
Camera Location: Airport Blvd in front of Watsonville Community Hospital
Camera Lat/long: 36.927511866270144, -121.79515700003752

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Moore

communications.subject: Your City of Watsonville, CA public records request #26-53 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Watsonville, CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-53 has been submitted successfully. Dear Requester:  The City of Watsonville ("City") is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted. The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act ("PRA") (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for information, that information is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request. Within the next ten (10) days, we will determine whether your request seeks copies of disclosable records in the City's possession or whether the City will require an extension. Sincerely,   City Clerk's Office (831) 768-3048 275 Main Street, Suite 400, Watsonville, CA 95076 FAX: 831-761-0736 E-mail:  cityclerk@watsonville.gov Open Monday - Friday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Watsonville, CA.

title: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
Jessica Riley 
1511 University Avenue, P.O. Box 6010
Morgantown, WV 26506-6010
January 23, 2026 

Angela King
Grant Administrator
The City of Beckley
409 S Kanawha St Beckley, WV 25801
aking@beckley.org

Dear Angela King:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to Beckley’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting: 
- Documentation of the amount of funds the city has received from the federal opioid lawsuit settlements
- The application forms that any organization would submit to receive settlement funds
- Documentation of how much city-level funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded
- Any completed application of an organization that has received settlement funds from the city
- Documentation of the process by which funds are awarded
- Any documents that contain the names of the individuals who review the funding applications and determine the awards
- Any documents that account for future plans from the city for the use of opioid settlement funds
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how the opioid settlement funds are being spent. I am a student journalist whose request is strictly for news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
Thank you for considering my request. 
Sincerely, Jessica Riley 
330-978-8228
jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu

title: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any notes, slideshows, visual displays, handout materials, or recording (including video, audio, or written transcript) made by staff (excluding any employee with an academic or faculty appointment) or administrators with any meeting with department chairs or faculty concerning or mentioning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

2. Any policy or written guidance concerning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

3. Any instructions to faculty or department chairs concerning any review of courses, course material, or syllabi as that review pertains to gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

These requests are limited to records generated on or after September 1, 2025. Please note that these requests do not seek a search of any faculty, student, faculty organization, or student organization records, and no such search should be conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:
Mr. Steinbaugh,

Thank you for your patience while we awaited the attorney general's decision. The attorney general has authorized the College to withhold all attorney-client information; his decision is attached. We are therefore releasing the remaining documents, with redactions as permitted by the attorney general.

Having released all responsive information, consistent with authorized redactions, the College now considers this matter closed.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Manatee County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Manatee County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Log# 2020-0005000 - Request all documents surrounding Log #2020-0005000

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Log# 2020-0005000 - Request all documents surrounding Log #2020-0005000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Request all documents and audio recordings surrounding CR Log# 2020-0005000 in request to reopen and investigate CR Log # 2019-0005248.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacqueline A. Watkins

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jacqueline Watkins, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our 
 Login: 202892-54155926@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, please request a Temporary Password using the Forgot Password option on the login screen. 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: OIDO MVPC

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OIDO MVPC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports from the OIDO office regarding overdoses, uses of force, or rape/sexual assault allegations at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center in Philipsburg, PA beginning in January 2023 and continuing through the date the agency tasks an adequate search in response to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Department of Homeland Security FOIA 2024-HQFO-01343 Final Response
communications.communication:
05/15/2024 

Andrew Free 
N/A 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 162789 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

Re:  2024-HQFO-01343 

Dear Requester: 

This is the electronic final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 4/29/2024, and received by this office on 4/29/2024.  You are seeking any reports from the OIDO office regarding overdoses, uses of force, or rape/sexual assault allegations at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center in Philipsburg, PA beginning in January 2023 and continuing through the date the agency tasks an adequate search in response to this request. 

We conducted a comprehensive search of files within the DHS Privacy Office for records that would be responsive to your request.  Unfortunately, we were unable to locate or identify any responsive records. 

While an adequate search was conducted, you have the right to appeal this determination that no records exist within DHS Privacy Office that would be responsive to your request.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to:  Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2).  Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below who processed your request and refer to 2024-HQFO-01343.  You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner.  Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge.
Regards, 

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office 
Department of Homeland Security 
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE 
Mail Stop 0655 
Washington, DC 20528-0655 
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov 
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-HQFO-01343
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We respectfully appeal the adequacy of this search. 

We believe adequate search — including iterative review and expansive term selection — of OIDO’s complaint database, inspection records, and notifications will yield responsive records and would be happy to provide specific dates within the original period on which records exist. 

Thank you,

Andrew Free

title: Founding Records of the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Program (1999) (Department Of Homeland Security Cisa (cybersecurity And Infrastructure Security Agency))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Founding Records of the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Program (1999) (Department Of Homeland Security Cisa (cybersecurity And Infrastructure Security Agency))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request copies of the following records:

The original Task Order or Statement of Work (SOW) issued to The MITRE Corporation in 1999, specifically authorizing the creation, development, and/or maintenance of the "Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures" (CVE) list/program.

The 1999 DARPA "Information Assurance" (IA) Program authorization documents that funded MITRE’s work on "common taxonomies" or "vulnerability enumerations" under the Air Force Electronic Systems Center (ESC) master contract.

The 2003 Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) or similar transfer document that shifted the sponsorship and funding of the CVE program from DARPA/DoD/Air Force to the newly formed DHS National Cyber Security Division (NCSD).

Record Description Clues: The CVE program was publicly launched in September 1999 following a white paper by David E. Mann and Steven M. Christey. At the time, MITRE was operating as a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) managed by the Air Force Electronic Systems Center (ESC) at Hanscom AFB.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

title: Flock Safety ALPR Audits 2025 (Wheaton, Il Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Flock Safety ALPR Audits 2025 (Wheaton, Il Police Department)
communications.communication:
RE: Flock Safety ALPR Audits

To the FOIA Officer of Wheaton, Il Police Department,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype.

3. Data Sharing
a. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data
b. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data
c. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information
d. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information

You may find that these requests result in a large number of files. These exports from the Flock system are standardized data formats that are inconsequential to redact. To remove private information, simply omit the "License Plate" column. We find that other agencies have had trouble with this until they realized they could do this.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the case of any applicable fees, it is requested that an estimate of the total charges be provided prior to fulfilling this request. The preferred method of receipt is through electronic delivery.

Your assistance and cooperation in this matter are greatly appreciated. A response within 5 business days, as the statute requires is anticipated.

Best,
David S. (he/him/his), Lucy Parsons Labs

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Galveston County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Galveston County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: New Message - 2024-HQFO-01341
communications.communication:
"05/01/2024


SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: 162787-99868396@requests.muckrock.com

Andrew Free
MuckRock News DEPT MR 162787
Boston, Massachusetts 02115

Re: 2024-HQFO-01341

Dear Requester:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 4/29/2024, and seeking all OIDO working papers, notes, worksheets, and email correspondence regarding OIDO-23-0001 (https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/OIDO%20Final%20Inspection%20Report%20-%20Moshannon%20Valley%20Processing%20Center_2.pdf).

Your request was received in this office on 4/29/2024.

After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is too broad in scope or did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking. Specifically, there is no date range provided in this request. Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency. For this reason, 6 C.F.R. Part 5 §5.3(b) of the DHS FOIA regulations require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort. Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the DHS component or office you believe created and/or controls the record. The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.

A list of DHS Component and Offices is located online to aid in providing more information: https://www.dhs.gov/operational-and-support-components. Additionally, your identified DHS Components or Offices may have their own FOIA office for FOIA request submissions. A list of DHS FOIA Offices is located online: https://www.dhs.gov/foia-contact-information. If your identified DHS Component or Office has a FOIA office, please submit directly to that office. Otherwise, respond back with your additional information.

Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking. This is not a denial of your request. Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request. If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.

You have a right to appeal the above determination. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

You may contact the DHS FOIA Public Liaison at 202-343-1743 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request. You may also contact OGIS at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-HQFO-01341. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or at 202-343-1743.

Regards,

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office
Department of Homeland Security
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
Mail Stop 0655
Washington, DC 20528-0655
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia"

communications.subject: Acknowledgment and Inform of Backlog
communications.communication:
Good morning,



Thank you for your reply. This correspondence confirms the receipt of your FOIA/PA request, seeking " list of 13 Property management Software Providers received Warning Letters (Press Release Dec. 9. 2025)." (simplified)



Due to the significant backlog caused by the federal shutdown, the FTC is processing requests as quickly as possible but has not yet begun to process yours. As soon as we are able, an individual FTC employee will reach out to let you know that they are starting work on your request and will provide their contact information.



In the meantime, if you have questions or concerns, please reach out to us at foia@ftc.gov<mailto:foia@ftc.gov>. You may also check the status of your FOIA request by visiting http://www.ftc.gov/about-ftc/foia/foia-reading-rooms/track-your-foia-request. This report is updated at the end of each month. If you should have any questions regarding your request, please contact us at foia@ftc.gov<mailto:foia@ftc.gov>. In any call or future correspondence concerning the request, please refer to the following case number FOIA-2026-00153.
Best,

FOIA Team

title: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of prison wardens and assistant wardens currently employed by the South Carolina Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division

2. A list of state-level commissioners/directors and deputy commissioners/directors currently employed by the South Carolina Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full name
- Official job title
- Division / bureau
- Official work email address
- Official office phone number
- Official work mailing address

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Morgan P Hatch Jr

communications.subject: FOIA 0413-25 Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
The South Carolina Department of Corrections is in receipt of your attached FOIA request regarding contact information for SCDC Commissioners and Wardens as of today, December 22, 2025. communications.subject: FOIA 0413-25 Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
Mr. Hatch,

The South Carolina Freedom of Information Act enumerates several matters which are exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Act or are excluded from the Act’s definition of a public record. Some of the records which you have requested in request 0413-25 are subject to one of these exemptions or exclusions. Specifically, some of the records you have requested are exempt or excluded based on the below listed sections of the FOIA statute. I have forwarded your request to the appropriate records custodians to obtain the requested documents if available.  You will receive these records within the applicable statutory timeframe pursuant to SC Code § 30-4-30(c). Please note that these records may be redacted pursuant to the below or any other applicable exemptions or exclusions.

Applicable exemption(s) and/or exclusion(s):
S.C. Code § 30-4-40(a)(2) A public body may exempt from disclosure information if release of that information would constitute an unreasonable invasion of personal privacy.
Sincerely,​
SCDC FOIA Office​
Post Office Box 21787​
Columbia, SC 29221-1787​
FOIA@doc.sc.gov<mailto:FOIA@doc.sc.gov>

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Acceptable Use Policy Info
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I have attached a document from The City of Joplin I would like more information about.  This is the City's acceptable use statement.  I am requesting the date the City began use of this document and the date it was last revised.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

title: New York FOIL Policies (New York State Police)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York FOIL Policies (New York State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Annual reports prepared by or for the agency that detail response times, compliance statistics, or other data related to the processing of public records requests. If quarterly or monthly reports are available, please also provide those. 

2. Statistical data or reports regarding the agency’s (a) average, (b) median, (c) shortest, and (d) longest processing times for public records requests for each year from January 1, 2020 to present.

3. Records showing the total number of public records requests pending as of the date of this request. If available, please include a breakdown of pending requests by duration (e.g., pending less than 30 days, 30–90 days, more than 90 days).

4. Policies, procedures, guidelines, memoranda, or training materials concerning how the agency determines or calculates the "statement of the approximate date, which shall be reasonable under the circumstances, when the request will be granted or denied," as required by Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a).

Requests 1, 2, and 4 are limited to records generated or in use on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
